intro: Hieracium adenocardoanum, commonly known as the腺叶蒲公英, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or toothed. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
